alert.note: Alert for Wabasha (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 2:33AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Wabasha, Buffalo and northern Trempealeau Counties through 330 AM CDT... At 232 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Plum City to 9 miles northeast of Mazeppa. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Wabasha and Kellogg around 255 AM CDT. Alma around 300 AM CDT. Modena around 310 AM CDT. Independence around 330 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Pioneer Campground, Cream, Chimney Rock, Mondovi Airfield, West Albany, County Roads F And K K, County Roads 33 And 4, The Borst Valley Area, Eleva and Pleasantville. This includes Interstate 94 between mile markers 88 and 90. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 AM CDT for southeastern Minnesota...and west central Wisconsin.
